Sentencas: The crystallization kinetics of a solid oxide fuel cell sealing glass were studied using a new isothermal differential thermal analysis (DTA) method.
Titulo: Isothermal Crystallization of a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Sealing Glass by Differential Thermal Analysis

Sentencas: The weight fraction of glass crystallized after an isothermal heat treatment was determined from the DTA crystallization peak area and the crystallization kinetic parameters were determined using the classical Johnson-Mehl-Avrami equation.
Titulo: Isothermal Crystallization of a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Sealing Glass by Differential Thermal Analysis

Sentencas: The glass, an alkaline earth-zinc-silicate composition, crystallized in the temperature range between 740 degrees and 950 degrees C.
Titulo: Isothermal Crystallization of a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Sealing Glass by Differential Thermal Analysis

Sentencas: The activation energy for crystallization varied with glass particle size and decreased from 570 +/- 25 to 457 +/- 30 kJ/mol as the average particle size decreased from 425-500 to similar to 10 pm.
Titulo: Isothermal Crystallization of a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Sealing Glass by Differential Thermal Analysis

Sentencas: The activation energy for crystallization, E, increased from 520 +/- 20 to similar to 600 +/- 20 kJ/mol when glass particles (45-53 mu m) were mechanically mixed with 10 vol% of micrometer-sized Ni or YSZ powders.
Titulo: Isothermal Crystallization of a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Sealing Glass by Differential Thermal Analysis

Sentencas: This increase in E reflects the effect of a second phase in composite seal systems, but is independent of the chemical nature of the additives.
Titulo: Isothermal Crystallization of a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Sealing Glass by Differential Thermal Analysis

Sentencas: The measured values of the Avrami exponent (n) indicate that surface crystallization is the dominant crystallization mechanism for this glass, particularly for small particle sizes, e.g. n = 0.9 +/- 0.1 for similar to 10 mu m.
Titulo: Isothermal Crystallization of a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Sealing Glass by Differential Thermal Analysis
